chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
L: Language
minL: MinimumLanguage L
pL: PropositionalLanguage L
sepconL: SepconLanguage L
wandL: WandLanguage L
GammaP: Provable L
GammaD: Derivable L
SC: NormalSequentCalculus L GammaP GammaD
bSC: BasicSequentCalculus L GammaD
minSC: MinimumSequentCalculus L GammaD
ipSC: IntuitionisticPropositionalSequentCalculus L GammaD
AX: NormalAxiomatization L GammaP GammaD
minAX: MinimumAxiomatization L GammaP
ipAX: IntuitionisticPropositionalLogic L GammaP
sepconAX: SepconAxiomatization L GammaP
wandAX: WandAxiomatization L GammaP
MD: Model
kMD: KripkeModel MD
M: Kmodel
R: Relation (Kworlds M)
J: Join (Kworlds M)
SM: Semantics L MD
fsepconSM: SepconSemantics L MD M SM
fwandSM: WandSemantics L MD M SM
cP: context -> Prop
rel: bijection (Kworlds M) {x : context | cP x}
H_R: forall (m n : Kworlds M) (Phi Psi : {x : context | cP x}), rel m Phi -> rel n Psi -> m <= n <-> Included expr (proj1_sig Phi) (proj1_sig Psi)
H_J: forall (m1 m2 m : Kworlds M) (Phi1 Phi2 Phi : {x : context | cP x}), rel m1 Phi1 -> rel m2 Phi2 -> rel m Phi -> join m1 m2 m <-> Included expr (context_sepcon (proj1_sig Phi1) (proj1_sig Phi2)) (proj1_sig Phi)
AL_DC: at_least derivable_closed cP
LIN_CD: forall x : expr, Lindenbaum_constructable (cannot_derive x) cP
LIN_SR: forall (Phi : context) (Psi : {x : context | cP x}), Lindenbaum_constructable (context_sepcon_included_r Phi (proj1_sig Psi)) cP
y: expr
x: expr
IHx: forall (m : Kworlds M) (Phi : {x : context | cP x}), rel m Phi -> KRIPKE: M, m |= x <-> proj1_sig Phi x
IHy: forall (m : Kworlds M) (Phi : {x : context | cP x}), rel m Phi -> KRIPKE: M, m |= y <-> proj1_sig Phi y

Goal:
forall (m : Kworlds M) (Phi : {x : context | cP x}), rel m Phi -> KRIPKE: M, m |= x -* y <-> proj1_sig Phi (x -* y)

Premises:
MinimumAxiomatization : forall L : Language, MinimumLanguage L -> Provable L -> Prop
SepconSemantics : forall L : Language, SepconLanguage L -> forall (MD : Model) (kMD : KripkeModel MD) (M : Kmodel), Relation (Kworlds M) -> Join (Kworlds M) -> Semantics L MD -> Prop
context = fun L : Language => expr -> Prop : Language -> Type Argument L is implicit and maximally inserted
Record Derivable (L : Language) : Type := Build_Derivable { derivable : context -> expr -> Prop } For Build_Derivable: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
proj1_sig : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), {x : A | P x} -> A
Lindenbaum_constructable : (Ensemble ?A -> Prop) -> (Ensemble ?A -> Prop) -> Prop where ?A : [L : Language minL : MinimumLanguage L pL : PropositionalLanguage L sepconL : SepconLanguage L wandL : WandLanguage L GammaP : Provable L GammaD : Derivable L SC : NormalSequentCalculus L GammaP GammaD bSC : BasicSequentCalculus L GammaD minSC : MinimumSequentCalculus L GammaD ipSC : IntuitionisticPropositionalSequentCalculus L GammaD AX : NormalA
WandSemantics : forall L : Language, WandLanguage L -> forall (MD : Model) (kMD : KripkeModel MD) (M : Kmodel), Relation (Kworlds M) -> Join (Kworlds M) -> Semantics L MD -> Prop
MinimumSequentCalculus : forall L : Language, MinimumLanguage L -> Derivable L -> Prop
Relation = fun worlds : Type => worlds -> Ensemble worlds : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
Record MinimumLanguage (L : Language) : Type := Build_MinimumLanguage { impp : expr -> expr -> expr } For Build_MinimumLanguage: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
Record Semantics (L : Language) (MD : Model) : Type := Build_Semantics { denotation : expr -> model -> Prop } For Build_Semantics: Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
Record SepconLanguage (L : Language) : Type := Build_SepconLanguage { sepcon : expr -> expr -> expr } For Build_SepconLanguage: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
join = fun (worlds : Type) (Join : Join worlds) => Join : forall worlds : Type, Join worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> Prop Arguments worlds, Join are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _]
NormalAxiomatization : forall L : Language, MinimumLanguage L -> Provable L -> Derivable L -> Prop
Record WandLanguage (L : Language) : Type := Build_WandLanguage { wand : expr -> expr -> expr } For Build_WandLanguage: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
IntuitionisticPropositionalSequentCalculus : forall L : Language, PropositionalLanguage L -> Derivable L -> Prop
Record KripkeModel (MD : Model) : Type := Build_KripkeModel { Kmodel : Type; Kworlds : Kmodel -> Type; build_model : forall M : Kmodel, Kworlds M -> model } For Build_KripkeModel: Argument scopes are [_ type_scope function_scope function_scope]
IntuitionisticPropositionalLogic : forall (L : Language) (minL : MinimumLanguage L), PropositionalLanguage L -> forall Gamma : Provable L, MinimumAxiomatization L Gamma -> Prop
derivable_closed = fun (L : Language) (Gamma : Derivable L) (Phi : context) => forall x : expr, Phi |-- x -> Phi x : forall L : Language, Derivable L -> context -> Prop Arguments L, Gamma are implicit and maximally inserted
Join = fun worlds : Type => worlds -> worlds -> worlds -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
expr = fun Language0 : Language => let (expr) := Language0 in expr : Language -> Type Argument Language is implicit and maximally inserted
Included : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop
WandAxiomatization : forall L : Language, MinimumLanguage L -> SepconLanguage L -> WandLanguage L -> Provable L -> Prop
Record bijection (A B : Type) : Type := Build_bijection { bij_R : A -> B -> Prop; im_bij : image_defined bij_R; pf_bij : Bijection.partial_functional bij_R; in_bij : injective bij_R; su_bij : surjective bij_R } For bijection: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For Build_bijection: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope _ _ _ _]
Kworlds = fun (MD : Model) (KripkeModel0 : KripkeModel MD) => let (Kmodel, Kworlds, _) as KripkeModel return (Kmodel -> Type) := KripkeModel0 in Kworlds : forall (MD : Model) (KripkeModel : KripkeModel MD), Kmodel -> Type Arguments MD, KripkeModel are implicit and maximally inserted
NormalSequentCalculus : forall L : Language, Provable L -> Derivable L -> Prop
Record PropositionalLanguage (L : Language) : Type := Build_PropositionalLanguage { andp : expr -> expr -> expr; orp : expr -> expr -> expr; falsep : expr } For Build_PropositionalLanguage: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope function_scope _]
at_least = fun (L : Language) (P cP : context -> Prop) => forall Phi : context, cP Phi -> P Phi : forall L : Language, (context -> Prop) -> (context -> Prop) -> Prop Argument L is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope function_scope]
context_sepcon = fun (L : Language) (sepconL : SepconLanguage L) (GammaD : Derivable L) (Phi Psi : context) (z : expr) => exists x y : expr, z = x * y /\ Phi |-- x /\ Psi |-- y : forall L : Language, SepconLanguage L -> Derivable L -> context -> context -> context Arguments L, sepconL, GammaD are implicit and maximally inserted
SepconAxiomatization : forall L : Language, MinimumLanguage L -> SepconLanguage L -> Provable L -> Prop
context_sepcon_included_r = fun (L : Language) (sepconL : SepconLanguage L) (GammaD : Derivable L) (Phi1 Psi Phi2 : context) => Included expr (context_sepcon Phi1 Phi2) Psi : forall L : Language, SepconLanguage L -> Derivable L -> context -> context -> context -> Prop Arguments L, sepconL, GammaD are implicit and maximally inserted
Record Provable (L : Language) : Type := Build_Provable { provable : expr -> Prop } For Build_Provable: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope]
cannot_derive = fun (L : Language) (Gamma : Derivable L) (x : expr) (Phi : context) => ~ Phi |-- x : forall L : Language, Derivable L -> expr -> context -> Prop Arguments L, Gamma are implicit and maximally inserted
BasicSequentCalculus : forall L : Language, Derivable L -> Prop
context_sepcon_included_l_context_orp_captured : forall Phi2 Psi : context, derivable_closed Psi -> orp_witnessed Psi ->...-> proj1_sig Phi y |- SepconOrAxiomatization ?L ?GammaP]
context_sepcon_consistent_rev_left : forall Phi1 Phi2 Psi : context, Included expr (context_sepcon Phi1 Phi2) Psi -> consistent Psi ->...-> proj1_sig Phi y |- SepconFalseAxiomatization ?L ?GammaP]
Classical.Axiomatization2SequentCalculus_cpSC : Classical.ClassicalPropositionalSequentCalculus ?L ?GammaD where ?L : [L : Language minL : MinimumLanguage L pL : PropositionalLanguage L sepconL : SepconLanguage L wandL : WandLanguage L GammaP : Provable L GammaD : Derivable L SC : NormalSequentCalculus L GammaP GammaD bSC : BasicSequentCalculus L GammaD minSC : MinimumSequentCalculus L GammaD ipSC : IntuitionisticPropositionalSequentCalculus L GammaD AX : NormalAxiomatization L GammaP GammaD minAX : MinimumAxiomatization L GammaP ipAX : IntuitionisticPropositionalLogic L GammaP sepconAX : SepconAxiomatization L GammaP wandAX : WandAxiomatization L GammaP MD : Model kMD...
Classical.SequentCalculus2Axiomatization_cpAX : Classical.ClassicalPropositionalLogic ?L ?GammaP where ?L : [L : Language minL : MinimumLanguage L pL : PropositionalLanguage L sepconL : SepconLanguage L wandL : WandLanguage L GammaP : Provable L GammaD : Derivable L SC : NormalSequentCalculus L GammaP GammaD bSC : BasicSequentCalculus L GammaD minSC : MinimumSequentCalculus L GammaD ipSC : IntuitionisticPropositionalSequentCalculus L GammaD AX : NormalAxiomatization L GammaP GammaD minAX : MinimumAxiomatization L GammaP ipAX : IntuitionisticPropositionalLogic L GammaP sepconAX : SepconAxiomatization L GammaP wandAX : WandAxiomatization L GammaP MD : Model kMD : Krip...
sat_orp : forall (m : Kworlds ?M) (x0 y0 : expr), KRIPKE: ?M, m |= x0 || y0 < ->...-> proj1_sig Phi y |- KripkePropositionalSemantics ?L ?MD ?M ?SM]
sat_andp : forall (m : Kworlds ?M) (x0 y0 : expr), KRIPKE: ?M, m |= x0 && y0 < ->...-> proj1_sig Phi y |- KripkePropositionalSemantics ?L ?MD ?M ?SM]
sat_falsep : forall m : Kworlds ?M, KRIPKE: ?M, m |= FF < ->...-> proj1_sig Phi y |- KripkePropositionalSemantics ?L ?MD ?M ?SM]
denote_falsep : Same_set (Kworlds ?M) (Kdenotation ?M FF) Semantics.falsep where ?L : [L : Language minL : MinimumLanguage L pL : PropositionalLanguage L sepconL : SepconLanguage L wandL : WandLanguage L GammaP : Provable L GammaD : Derivable L SC : NormalSequentCalculus L GammaP GammaD bSC : BasicSequentCalculus L GammaD minSC : MinimumSequentCalculus L GammaD ipSC : IntuitionisticPropositionalSequentCalculus L GammaD AX : NormalAxiomatization L GammaP GammaD minAX : MinimumAxiomatization L GammaP ipAX : IntuitionisticPropositionalLogic L GammaP sepconAX : SepconAxiomatization L GammaP wandAX : WandAxiomatization L GammaP MD : Model kMD : Krip...
